title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
This affects the package pimcore/pimcore before 6.8.8. A Local FIle Inclusion vulnerability exists in the downloadCsvAction function of the CustomReportController class (bundles/AdminBundle/Controller/Reports/CustomReportController.php). An authenticated user can reach this function with a GET request at the following endpoint: /admin/reports/custom-report/download-csv?exportFile=&91;filename]. Since exportFile variable is not sanitized, an attacker can exploit a local file inclusion vulnerability.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-23340
  • https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/commit/1786bdd4962ee51544fad537352c2b4223309442
  • https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/blob/v6.7.2/bundles/AdminBundle/Controller/Reports/CustomReportController.php%23L454
  • https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-PHP-PIMCOREPIMCORE-1070132
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-h7f9-cvh5-qw7f
items.title: [pimcore/pimcore] Path traversal in pimcore/pimcore

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in moodle before versions 3.5.1, 3.4.4, 3.3.7, 3.1.13. When a quiz question bank is imported, it was possible for the question preview that is displayed to execute JavaScript that is written into the question bank.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-10891
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-10891
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=373371
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/0b18d0c960c27994dd9870d286f2da3fa5868c06
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210124185945/https://www.securityfocus.com/bid/104739/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p7v9-gjrh-563x
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle XSS Vulnerability

items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
In Moodle 2.x and 3.x, text injection can occur in email headers, potentially leading to outbound spam.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-5013
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=336698
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/ed63718caa48803843a14140d8a27f04aba9c8c4
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210123154543/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/92040
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2hh3-jmv8-5fmx
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Does Not Escape Characters In Email Headers

items.content_html:
Insufficient capability checks could allow users with the moodle/site:uploadusers capability to delete users, without having the necessary moodle/user:delete capability.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-0985
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2064117
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/addd4f894d8173ec8ff0ae2212d51a1977e7bcad
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6q9g-3vfq-q2qj
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Improper Authentication in moodle

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in moodle where ID numbers displayed when bulk allocating markers to assignments required additional sanitizing to prevent a stored XSS risk.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-30596
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2083583
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=434578

  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/6abe964bbac41b5e40a81b40962f7044b0dc201e

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in moodle where the description user field was not hidden when being set as a hidden user field.
